member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Productivity.AutoComplete
member.summary: Implementation for the Auto Complete Productivity feature.
member.remarks: You can configure Auto Complete settings, including presentation of suggestions and handling of field data. The Auto Complete feature recalls what you type and makes suggestions to help populate fields as it learns common, repeated commands.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Productivity.AutoComplete.AutoCompleteOverwrite
member.summary: Gets or sets how text that follows a completion is treated.
member.remarks:
Gets or sets how text that follows a completion is treated.
Values:
EraseToEOFMode Erases all data remaining in the field following the completion.
InsertMode Inserts the completion and pushes all following data toward the end of the field.
OverwriteMode Overwrites any existing field data.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such modifications require Administrator privileges.

member.summary: Creates a new word-processing document.
member.param: The text to insert in the document. If null (or in Visual Basic, Nothing) is passed in, a textual representation of the current host screen is inserted.
A template to use when creating the new document. If null, invalid, or not found (or in Visual Basic, Nothing), no template is used.
A location in the templated document to insert the text. If invalid, null, or not specified (or in Visual Basic, Nothing), text is inserted at the beginning of the document.

member.summary: Creates a new word-processing document with graphics.

The template for creating new documents. If null, invalid, or not found (or in Visual Basic, Nothing) no template is used.
The location in the template to insert a graphic. If null, invalid, or not specified (or in Visual Basic, Nothing), the graphic is inserted at the beginning of the document.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Productivity.IOfficeTools.CloseOfficeDocsOnAppExit
member.summary: Determines if documents created by Office Tools and Office Suite applications close when Reflection closes (true), or if they stay open (false).
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such modifications require Administrator privileges.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Productivity.IOfficeTools.IncludeScreenData
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to insert host screen data in new Office items.
member.remarks: If true, the live host screen (or the active selection on that screen) is inserted into newly created Office documents. If false, no host data is inserted.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such modifications require Administrator privileges.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Productivity.IOfficeTools.CopyAsImage
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to copy the host screen data as an image (true) or as text (false) if images are supported by the Office Suite.
member.remarks: If the document type supports only text, the document will always copy screen data as text, regardless of this value.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such modifications require Administrator privileges.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Productivity.IOfficeTools.WordProcessingTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the path of the template to use when creating a word-processing document.

member.remarks: If privacy filters are enforced, sensitive data in unprotected fields will be replaced in the screen capture by the first filter that has matching criteria.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Productivity.IScreenHistory.GetLiveScreenImage
member.summary: Returns the live screen as an image.
member.remarks:
Returned images are subject to currently enforced privacy filters.
This method can be used in conjunction with the ScreenChanged event to build a list of screen images.
The returned image can be used in conjunction with the Productivity.OfficeTools CreateWordProcessingDocumentWithGraphicSet method if the installed Office Suite and Office Tools adapter assembly support the use of graphics in word-processing documents.
member.returns: The live screen, in image format.
member.remarks: Returns the live screen as an image.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Productivity.IScreenHistory.GetHistoryScreenImage(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a history screen as an image.
member.remarks: Returned images are subject to currently configured privacy filters. The returned image can be used in conjunction with the Productivity.OfficeTools CreateWordProcessingDocumentWithGraphicSet method if the installed Office Suite and Office Tools adapter assembly support the use of graphics in word-processing documents.
member.param: The zero-based index of the history screen to capture. This must be a value between 0 and Count-1.
member.returns: An image of the specified history screen.
member.exception: This exception is thrown if the index does not correspond to a valid screen index in the current Screen History list.

member.summary: Loads a screen history file into the session document.

If true, clears current contents first before loading from file. If false, file contents are appended to screen list.
member.returns: ReturnCode.Success if the load succeeds, ReturnCode.Error if it failed.

member.summary: Saves screen history contents to the specified file.

If true, overwrites an existing copy of the file. If false, the file will not be saved if it already exists.
member.remarks: If filePath exists, the file is overwritten.
member.returns: ReturnCode.Success if the save succeeded, ReturnCode.Error if it failed.

member.summary: Implementation of the Screen History, a Productivity feature.

parent productivity object

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Productivity.ScreenHistory.CaptureScreen
member.summary: Captures the current host screen (including data in non-hidden fields) and adds it to the Screen History list.
member.remarks: If data in an unprotected field matches one or more currently enforced privacy filters, the first matching filter will replace the data in the screen capture image.

example.code: ScreenHistory scr = new ScreenHistory(IScreenHistory IScr,IProductivity Iprod); scr.CaptureScreen();

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Productivity.ScreenHistory.ShowLiveScreen
member.summary: Shows the current host screen from anywhere in the Screen History sequence.

member.summary: Shows the next host screen from the Screen History list in read-only mode.

example.code: ScreenHistory scr = new ScreenHistory(IScreenHistory IScr,IProductivity Iprod); scr.Forward();

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Productivity.ScreenHistory.Back
member.summary: Shows the previous host screen from the Screen History list in read-only mode.

example.code: ScreenHistory scr = new ScreenHistory(IScreenHistory IScr,IProductivity Iprod); scr.Back();

member.summary: Deletes a specific screen from the Screen History list.
member.param: Specifies the zero-based index of the screen to delete from the list.
member.exception: This exception is thrown if the index value is negative or exceeds the range of available screens.

example.code: ScreenHistory scr = new ScreenHistory(IScreenHistory IScr,IProductivity Iprod); scr.DeleteScreen(2);

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Productivity.ScreenHistory.ShowScreen(System.Int32)
member.summary: Shows a specific screen from the Screen History list.
member.param: The zero-based index of the screen to make active.
member.exception: This exception is thrown if the index value is negative or if it exceeds the range of available screens.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Productivity.ScreenHistory.GetLiveScreenImage
member.summary: Returns the live screen as an image.
member.remarks:
The returned image is subject to currently configured privacy filters.
This method can be used in conjunction with the ScreenChanged event to build a list of screen images. The returned image can be used in conjunction with the Productivity.OfficeTools CreateWordProcessingDocumentWithGraphicSet method, provided that the installed Office Suite and Office Tools adapter assembly support the use of graphics in word-processing documents.
member.returns: The live screen, in image format.

example.code: ScreenHistory scr = new ScreenHistory(IScreenHistory IScr,IProductivity Iprod); byte[] image = scr.GetLiveScreenImage();

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Productivity.ScreenHistory.GetHistoryScreenImage(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a screen image from the Screen History.
member.param: The zero-based index of the history screen to be captured. This must be a value between 0 and Count-1 (total number of history screens minus one).
member.returns: An image of the specified screen. The returned image is subject to currently configured privacy filters. The returned image can be used in conjunction with the method, provided that the installed Office suite and the installed Office Tools adapter assembly support the use of graphics in word-processing documents.
member.exception: This exception is thrown if the index value doesn't correspond to a valid screen index in the current Screen History.

example.code: ScreenHistory scr = new ScreenHistory(IScreenHistory IScr,IProductivity Iprod); byte[] image = scr.GetHistoryScreenImage(5);

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Productivity.ScreenHistory.OpenScreenHistoryFile(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Loads a screen history file into the session document.
member.param: The name of the file to load screen history from
If true, clears current contents first before loading from file. If false, file contents are appended to screen list.
member.returns: ReturnCode.Success if the load succeeds, ReturnCode.Error if it failed

member.summary: Saves screen history contents to the specified file.
member.param: The full pathname of the file to save the screen history contents to
If true, overwrites an existing copy of the file. If false, the file will not be saved if it already exists.
member.returns: ReturnCode.Success if the save succeeded, ReturnCode.Error if it failed.
member.remarks: If filePath exists, the file is overwritten.

The word that replaces the misspelled word.
member.exception: This exception is thrown if either of the input arguments are null (or in Visual Basic are Nothing).
This exception is thrown if the correction string parameter is zero-length (empty).

example.code: SpellCheck spl = new SpellCheck(ISpellCheck ICheck,IProductivity Iprod); spl.CorrectMisspelling(MisspelledWord miss,"correct string");

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Productivity.SpellCheck.AddToCustomDictionary(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a word to the active custom dictionary.
member.remarks: The setting has no effect if a custom dictionary isn't specified. After a word is added to the custom dictionary, it is no longer considered as being misspelled.
member.param: The word to add to the dictionary.
member.exception: Thrown if the input argument is null (or in Visual Basic is Nothing).
Thrown if the input parameter is zero-length (empty).

example.code: SpellCheck spl = new SpellCheck(ISpellCheck ICheck,IProductivity Iprod); spl.AddToCustomDictinary("Word");

member.summary: Gets the parent object (IProductivity).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Productivity.SpellCheck.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Spell Check is enabled in the session.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.

example.code: SpellCheck spl = new SpellCheck(ISpellCheck ICheck,IProductivity Iprod); spl.Enabled = true;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Productivity.SpellCheck.AutoCorrect
member.summary: Gets or sets whether spelling mistakes are automatically corrected as you type, provided that Auto Correct suggestions for the misspelled word are available.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.

example.code: SpellCheck spl = new SpellCheck(ISpellCheck ICheck,IProductivity Iprod); spl.AutoCorrect = true;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Productivity.SpellCheck.CheckSpellingAsType
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Reflection automatically reviews words for spelling errors as you type, adding wavy red lines under possibly misspelled words.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.

example.code: SpellCheck spl = new SpellCheck(ISpellCheck ICheck,IProductivity Iprod); spl.CheckSpellingAsType = true;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Productivity.SpellCheck.IgnoreAllUppercase
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to exclude words that use only uppercase letters from a spelling review. True excludes these words; false doesn't exclude them.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.

example.code: SpellCheck spl = new SpellCheck(ISpellCheck ICheck,IProductivity Iprod); spl.IgnoreAllUppercase = true;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Productivity.SpellCheck.IgnoreWordsWithNumbers
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to exclude words that contain numerals from a spelling review. True excludes these words; false doesn't exclude them.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.

example.code: SpellCheck spl = new SpellCheck(ISpellCheck ICheck,IProductivity Iprod); spl.IgnoreWordsWithNumbers = true;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Productivity.SpellCheck.CorrectTwoInitialCaps
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to correct a word that begins with two or more uppercase letters to a word that begins with a single uppercase letter.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.

example.code: SpellCheck spl = new SpellCheck(ISpellCheck ICheck,IProductivity Iprod); spl.CorrectTwoInitialCaps = true;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Productivity.SpellCheck.CorrectAccidentalCapsLock
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to correct a word that begins with a lowercase letter and is followed by all uppercase letters to a word that begins with a single uppercase letter.
member.remarks: This also switches the state of the CAPS lOCK key.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.

example.code: SpellCheck spl = new SpellCheck(ISpellCheck ICheck,IProductivity Iprod); spl.CorectAccidentalCapsLock = true;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Productivity.SpellCheck.CustomDictionaryPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the full path to the custom dictionary file to use with Spell Check.
member.remarks: To not specify a custom dictionary, specify an empty string as the parameter instead of Null(or in Visual Basic, Nothing).
member.exception: Thrown if the set value is Null (or in Visual Basic, is Nothing).
This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.

example.code: SpellCheck spl = new SpellCheck(ISpellCheck ICheck,IProductivity Iprod); spl.CustomDictionaryPath = "Dictionary file path";

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Productivity.SpellCheck.MinimumMatch
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum length of fields reviewed for spelling errors.
member.remarks: The valid range of values is 2 - 1920. The default is 8.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when the specified value is outside the valid range.
This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.

example.code: SpellCheck spl = new SpellCheck(ISpellCheck ICheck,IProductivity Iprod); spl.MinimumMatch = 1;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Productivity.SpellCheck.MaxSuggestions
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of spelling suggestions for a misspelled word.
member.remarks: The range of valid values is 1 - 10. The default is 6.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when the specified value is outside the valid range of values.
This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.

example.code: SpellCheck spl = new SpellCheck(ISpellCheck ICheck,IProductivity Iprod); spl.MaxSuggestions = 10;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Productivity.SpellCheck.MaxWordLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum length of words checked for spelling (between 20-200 characters). Longer words are ignored by the spell checker.
member.exception: This exception is thrown if set value is outside the valid range.
This exception is thrown if you modify a Reflection property that's been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Productivity.SpellCheck.MainLanguage
member.summary: Gets or sets the language dictionary to use with Spell Check if the Spell Check engine supports multiple languages.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when the specified value is outside the valid range of values.
This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.

example.code: SpellCheck spl = new SpellCheck(ISpellCheck ICheck,IProductivity Iprod); spl.MainLanguage = SpellingLanguage.EnglishUS;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.UserInterface.IFrame.StatusBarText
member.summary: Gets the text displayed on the status bar.

value.para: The default is "&s - &c". The maximum string length is 260 characters. Various special characters can be included in this string:

item.description: Settings File Name (or 'Untitled' if a settings file is not open)
Connection Status (whether you are connected and over what transport)
Printer Status (relevant only in if the Session Type is IBM 5250 Printer or IBM 3270 Printer)
Transfer Status (the percentage complete of file and data transfers)
Assigned Device Name (relevant only for 5250 sessions that use an assigned Device Name)
Assigned LU Name (relevant only for 3270 sessions that use an assigned LU Name)

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.UserInterface.IFrame.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets the visibility of the Reflection terminal window.

remarks.para: The Reflection terminal window is typically hidden when you start Reflection from another application using Automation.

Setting Visible to False is not the same as minimizing Reflection. (Use the WindowState property to minimize Reflection.) When Reflection is minimized, it appears on the Windows Task List and can brought into view in various ways. When Reflection is not visible it does not appear on the Task List and can be brought into view only by setting the Visible property to True.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Web.Msie.IWebDocument.GetElement(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the first Web element by an XPath path, relative to the current Web element.
member.param: An XPath path pointing to a WebElement in the WebDocument.
member.remarks: XPath is a language that describes how to locate specific elements in XML documents by using an addressing syntax. This syntax is based on a path through the document's logical structure or hierarchy. A sample XPath syntax: HTML/BODY/TABLE/TBODY/TR[1]/TD[1], where WebElement index starts from 0.
member.returns: WebElement found, or null if no WebElement was found.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Web.Msie.WebElement.SetAttribute(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the value of the named attribute on the element.
member.param: The name of the attribute to set.
The new value of this attribute.
member.exception: This exception is thrown if an invalid operation executes.
member.remarks:
An attribute in HTML is any valid name-value pair for that element. HtmlElement exposes only those attributes that are common to all elements. For example, SRC is a predefined attribute for the IMG tag, but not for the DIV tag.
Use GetAttribute and SetAttribute to manipulate attributes that aren't exposed on the managed Document Object Model (DOM). If attributeName is not a defined attribute on an element, SetAttribute defines it on the element as a new attribute. GetAttribute and SetAttribute are not case-sensitive. To set the class attribute on an HtmlElement, you must refer to the attribute as className when specifying the first argument to SetAttribute.

example.code:
private Attachmate.Reflection.Web.Msie.WebElement WElement;
WElement.SetAttribute("SRC", "http://www.adatum.com/images/footer-banner.jpg");
